title: Laws for Burnt Offerings
summary: Leviticus 1 introduces the burnt offering, a voluntary sacrifice for worship, atonement, and dedication to God. The offering must be a male without defect and completely burned on the altar.

faq.question: What was the purpose of the burnt offering?
faq.answer: It was an act of worship and atonement, symbolizing complete devotion to God.

faq.question: What kind of animal could be offered?
faq.answer: A male from the herd or flock, without blemish.
